newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo naphtha loses ground in technical correction.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo naphtha loses ground in technical correction.

text.p: Tokyo naphtha prices fell in Friday afternoon trade in a technical correction, market participants said.
"As the market was too firm at the beginning of this week, it's correcting itself." one naphtha trader said.
Open-spec naphtha for second-half May was said to have been traded at $233.50 between Japanese trading houses. It was assessed at $240.00/241.00 in late Wednesday trading.
The Tokyo oil products market was closed on Thursday for a national holiday.
First-half June was quoted at about $230.00/232.00 in Friday afternoon dealing. It was sold once at $239.75, and again at $237.50 to a Japanese trader on Wednesday.
Also on Wednesday, second-half June was bought by the same trader at $235.50.
In low sulphur waxy residue (LSWR) trading, activity was subdued with traders waiting for initial April allocations from Indonesia's state-owned Pertamina.
Traders expect the initial allotment to total about 3.7 million barrels, including 400,000 to 600,000 barrels rolled over from March. --Tokyo Energy Desk +81-3-3432-8837
